name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.

all_citations.claim: The charity reports a 100.0% program expense ratio, 0.2 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The organization reported a total revenue of $223,205 in the 2023 fiscal year.
Muslim Wellness Foundation promotes emotional well-being through Mental Health First Aid trainings and the Black Muslim Psychology Conference.
The Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC) is a core program of the foundation.
The organization accepts general charitable donations and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate score of 54/100, reflecting a strong commitment to program spending offset by significant concerns regarding financial liquidity and data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Very low working capital of 0.2 months, indicating limited financial reserves for long-term sustainability [1].
Low data confidence due to limited third-party verification and public financial disclosures [2].
Limited evidence of direct impact scaling or cost-per-beneficiary metrics [3].

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is rated at 29/50, reflecting a high urgency for global health and mental health services within minority communities [3]. However, the donor fit is considered low for traditional Muslim donors as the organization is designated as sadaqah-eligible only, and there is limited information regarding its broader institutional track record [5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a moderate impact score of 27/50, as its work is primarily focused on capacity building through MHFA trainings and conferences [3]. While the organization maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data and low data confidence of 0.3 limit the ability to fully verify its long-term effectiveness [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Wellness Foundation Inc is a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and emotional well-being within the American Muslim community through specialized mental health programming.
strengths: Maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio, directing all reported spending toward its core initiatives [1].
High fundraising efficiency with a reported cost of $0.00 per $1 raised [1].
Provides specialized programming such as the Black Muslim Psychology Conference to address intersectional community needs [4].
baseline_narrative.summary: The organization focuses on community healing by providing Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings and hosting the Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC) [3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the foundation reported a total revenue of $223,205 to support its mission-driven initiatives [2].
